parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Team Switch

</value></part><part><name>gr3</name>=<value> Object Detection

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns a list of playable units available for switching to.
Command is relative to the client on which it is executed and will only show playable units for the same [[side]] as [[player]]'s [[group]] + [[player]] himself,
unless in singleplayer where playable units from all sides will be accessible via this command.<br>
Dead and player-controlled units are automatically removed from the resulting array.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> In Multiplayer, [[switchableUnits]] are only available when [[description.ext#respawn|respawn]] type is set to SIDE or GROUP, the mission contains units marked playable and [[player]] is able to switch to any of those units. </value></part></template><br>
In order to get all ''playable'' units regardless of their [[side]], see the [[playableUnits]] command.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[switchableUnits]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> _availableUnits = [[switchableUnits]];

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allPlayers]], [[units]], [[allCurators]], [[allGroups]], [[allDead]], [[playableUnits]], [[vehicles]], [[allUnitsUAV]], [[allDeadMen]], [[teamSwitch]], [[Team_Switch]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on July 06, 2011 - 13:32</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Messiah2|Messiah2]]</dt>
<dd class="note">On dedicated server this command returns empty array.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
